p: African swine fever (ASF) is a highly contagious animal infectious disease caused by African swine fever virus (ASFV) infecting both wild ( Sus scrofa) and domestic swine of all breeds and ages. ASF with the acute form has a rapid onset and a short course of disease, which are characterized by high fever, loss of appetite, cyanosis, severe bleeding of internal organs and a high mortality rate of nearly 100% [ 1, 2]. The less virulent strains can lead to mild clinical signs, subacute forms of disease, or even chronic infections.
